summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing scheduling a meeting to work on a reply memo concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention. The email indicates high-level executive involvement.

persons.name: (USANYS) 6
persons.context: An individual in the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) who is coordinating scheduling for a meeting about the Epstein detention reply memo. They mention being in DC for a panel on Tuesday.

persons.name: (USANYS) (Contractor)
persons.role: Special Assistant to the U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email who requests rescheduling a meeting to Tuesday at 11am to work on the Epstein detention reply memo, noting that 'Exec is fully hands on' with it.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on legal work related to Jeffrey Epstein's detention.

events.title: Proposed meeting on Epstein detention memo
events.description: A meeting is proposed for Tuesday, July 16, 2019, at 11am to work on a reply memo concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively working on a reply memo concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention in July 2019.
A high-level executive ('Exec') was described as 'fully hands on' with the Epstein detention reply memo, indicating significant attention from leadership.
The email chain shows internal coordination and scheduling efforts among legal personnel shortly after Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
